label: 七僧
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The Seven Monks, performers of the leading roles at major Buddhist services were the Kōji (Lecturer, expounder of texts), the Tokushi (Reader, reciter of texts), the Juganshi (invoker, reader of the sponsor's petition), the Sanraishi (Triple Worshiper, performer of he triple bow), the Baishi (Intoner, chanter of Sanskrit or Chinese hymns), the Sangeshi (Flower-scatterer), and the Dōtatsu (Transmitter, hander of petition to the Juganshi) (p. 509). [講師、読師、呪願師、三禮師、唄師、散華師、堂達]
